lines.text: Well that's gonna cost you overtime because I'm a union man and I work only sixteen hours a day.
A union man only works eight hours a day.
I belong to two unions.
Young people making the most of life - while it lasts.
Get up on your feet. It's only a dummy
Dummy nothin'. It was smart enough to scare me.
People pay McDougal cash to come in here and get scared.
I'm cheatin' him. I'm gettin' scared for nothin'.
I'm going out to get the other crate. And no back talk!
I've got just two words to say to you.
What is that?
Hurry back.
You know that person you said there's no such person? I think he's in there... in person. I was reading this sign over here, Dracula's Legend. All of a sudden I heard...
[Wilbur imitates a creaking noise]
That's the wind.
It should get oiled.
You're making enough noise to wake up the dead!
I don't have to wake him up. He's up.
I know there's no such person as Dracula. You know there's no such person as Dracula.
But does Dracula know it?
Soon the moon will rise. I've taken the room across the hall; here's the key, lock me in.
Lock you in?
Yes, please. Hurry.
[to Chick]
He's scared too.
Why don't you get down to the police station and tell them you know the story of Dracula and Monster they'd be very interested.
I can't do that because then I'd have to tell them who I am and how I know what I know.
I've got a date. In fact I've got two dates.
But you and I 'have a date with destiny'.
Let Chick go with Destiny.
Well after what I saw, there'd better not be any 'maybe'.
And another thing Mr. Chick Young! The next time I tell you that I saw something when I saw it, you believe me that I saw it!
Oh relax. Now that we've seen the last of Dracula, the Wolf Man, and the Monster, there's nobody to frighten us anymore.
Oh, that's too bad. I was hoping to get in on the excitement.
Who said that?
Allow me to introduce myself. I'm the Invisible Man.
I've had this brain for thirty years. It hasn't done me any good!
You still want your exhibits?
Of course I do.
Here comes one of 'em now!
You know the old saying? Everything comes in threes. Now suppose a third girl should fall in love with you?
What's her name?
We'll say her name is Mary.
Is she pretty?
Beautiful!
Naturally, she'd have to be.
Now you have Mary, you have Joan, and you have Sandra. So, to prove to you that I'm your pal, your bosom friend, I'll take one of the girls off your hands.
Chick, you're what I call a real pal... you take Mary.
I just got a line on Dracula and the Monster. A certain Dr. Lajos has been receiving a lot of electrical equipment - just the type necessary to revive the Monster.
So what? I'm way out on an island. I got my own problems.
Yes, but listen... I believe you're in the house of Dracula right now!
So! We meet again, Count Dracula.
Dracula?
Yes. That's who he says you are.
Oh. My costume perhaps?

[jokingly]
No. Talbot here thinks you're the real thing.
Uh-huh. Right out of McDougal's House of Horrors.
What an odd hallucination. But, the human mind is often inflamed with strange complexes. I suggest you consult your physician, Mr. Talbot.

[referring to Wilbur]
And take him along with you, please.
[Trying to evade the monster, Wilbur puts on a black cloak over his face]

[imitating Dracula]
Back! Back!
Yes, master.

[takes off cloak and turns to Chuck]
He thinks I'm Dracula!
What we need is young blood... and brains...

[the phone rings]
Answer that phone.
[a lady rings the bell for service]
Answer the bell.
[the phone rings again]
Answer the phone!
Which one do you want me to answer first?
Both of them!

[mocks him]
Both of them! Both of them!

[whispering]
Hey, will you please stop yelling. Come here.
[continues whispering]
Don't you know it's impolite to raise your voice?
[screams]
Oh Chick!

[Larry Talbot's called about Mr. McDougal's packages and is turning into the wolf, growling and snarling]
Mr. McDougal, will you stop gargling your throat?
[growling continues]
Hey, you're gonna have to get your dog away from the phone, I can't hear a word you're saying.
[growling and snarling continues]
You're awful silly to call me all the way from London just to have your dog talk to me.
[hears the snarling and barks in response]
My name's McDougal, now where are my shipments?
McDougal? I just got off the phone with you in London, how'd you get here so fast, did you shoot out of a cannon?
AHHHHHHHHHHHHHHH!
Who screamed?
You did.

[amused]
I did?
[Wilbur answers the door and Joan kisses him]
Oh, oh...
Now who is this?
She's, she's beautiful.
I'm Joan Raymond.

[shrugging]
She's Joan Raymond.
Miss Raymond, would you honor me with a dance?
No, I warn you, he is Count Dracula.
How interesting. Tell me more.
Let "me" tell you, while we dance. Pardon me, Mr. Talbot.
I must warn you my dear Sandra. I am accustomed to having my orders obeyed. Especially by women with a price on their heads.
Don't try to scare me, Count Dracula.
Look into my eyes.
Look! Deeper. Tell me what you see.
Have you seen Chick Young or Wilbur Grey?
Seen 'em? I don't even know them.
Professor, do you understand women?
I don't even try. I'm gonna get me a drink.
Oh Wilbur, can't we both come along too?
Yes, mon amour.
That's Spanish.
That's French.
How do you like that, I speak French too.

[Chick calls Wilbur from across the room]
Miss Raymond, will you excuse me.
[looking at himself in the mirror]
Oh you irresistible boy.

[to Chick]
You want me.

[grabs Wilbur and pulls him towards the window]
Yes I want you. Come over here. I just wanted to get a good look at you in the light.
I still don't get it.
Jealous?
What I'd like to know is, what does he got they I haven't got?
A brain.

[flattered]
Oh, a brain.
I'd like to know where it is.
Oh, boy! I'm floatin' on a cloud of love!
Listen, you little blimp! I'll let the air out of you in a minute if you don't give me a hand.
[slams a bag into Wilbur's head]
Ya understand that?
Thank You.
Boy, is this kid lost!
Look into my eyes!
[Wilbur looks into her eyes and sees two bats flapping their wings]
Don't you know what's going to happen now?
I'll bite.
No, I will.

[gives Wilbur a key]
Lock me in, and no matter what you hear or what you might think, don't let me out!

And about the brain? I don't want to repeat Frankenstein's mistake and revive a vicious, unmanageable brute. This time the Monster must have no will of his own, no fiendish intellect to oppose his Master.
Nervous, my dear?
This is risky business.
What's the matter?
I know you'll think I'm crazy, but... in a half-an-hour the moon will rise and I'll turn into a wolf.
You and 20 million other guys!
I don't get it. Out of all the guys around here that classy dish has to pick out a guy like you.
What's wrong with that?
Go look at yourself in the mirror sometime.
Why should I hurt my own feelings?
Mr. Talbot, and I thought you were such a nice man too. Look at you, you're a mess.
Last night I went through another one of my horrible experiences. Many years ago I was bitten by a werewolf. Now, whenever the full moon rises I turn into a wolf myself.
Oh pal. That's all right; I'm sort of a wolf myself.
I know you'll think I'm crazy, but in a half an hour the moon will rise and I'll turn into a wolf.
You and twenty million other guys.

[slamming Wilbur into a locker with Chick going in behind him]
Listen! I might tear you limb from limb!

[turning to Chick in the locker]
Is that serious?
He'll murder ya!

[turns to Talbot]
That's serious.
I saw what I saw when I saw it!
What are you doing tonight?
He's going to a masquerade ball but I'm not doing anything.
In that case you'll be awfully lonesome.
That girl, who is he?
Um, hmm... hmm... uh... sh... she's chick's date. She's going to the masquerade with us.
But I told you to come alone. I'll have to get rid of her.
I'll have to get rid of somebody.
Well, you young people. Making the most of life. While it lasts.
You can have Sandra but make sure you get plenty of bandages.
Don't you know what's going to happen now?
I'll bite.
Oh, no. I will.
Dracula is Dracula. And Sandra's gonna use my brain to make a bigger dummy out of the other dummy.
Please give me a little ether.
We don't need it. You won't feel a thing.
Now listen, Talbot. Enough is enough. Now Wilbur's scared to death. Hello? Hello? He's gone.
So am I.
No you don't come here. I'm gonna settle this thing once and for all. We'll search this place.
Look Chick, it's a little past sunset and if Dracula is here he's gonna be wanting breakfast, and I'm fatter than you, and it ain't gonna be me.
